testCases.explanation: Merge triplets [2,5,3] and [1,7,5] to get max([2,5,3],[1,7,5])=[2,7,5] which equals target
No valid combination of triplets can produce target [3,2,5]; target[1]=2 cannot be achieved
Merge [2,5,3] and [1,2,5] and [5,5,1] to reach max = [5,5,5]
The single triplet already equals the target
No triplet or combination can reach target [2,3,4] since all values exceed available triplets

description: A triplet is an array of three integers. You may apply a merge operation: choose two triplets [a,b,c] and [d,e,f] and update the second to [max(a,d), max(b,e), max(c,f)]. Return true if it is possible to obtain the target triplet [x,y,z] as an element of triplets after some number of merge operations.

examples.explanation: Perform the following operations: Choose the first and third triplets. Update the third to [max(2,1), max(5,7), max(3,5)] = [2,7,5].
